description: DOMAIN: Texts (T) Students grow in their learning as they purposefully engage with texts.
details: CASE TOC context: English Language Arts Courses with Adopted Standards > Elementary English Language Arts K-5 > Language Arts/Grade Kindergarten
ALD: 3.T.C.1: Purpose & Audience - Use knowledge of purposes and audiences, as well as the language that develops those relationships, to make meaning of texts in multiple modes. Four achievement levels apply with cumulative progression. 3.T.C.2: Authors & Speakers - Make connections between authors of texts, speakers in texts, varying perspectives, and the circumstances in which texts are produced. Four achievement levels apply with cumulative progression. 3.T.SS.1: Organization - Demonstrate and apply understanding of organizational structures and elements to create coherent and engaging texts. Four achievement levels apply with cumulative progression.
evidence: K-2.T.C.1 (Purpose & Audience) Explain how authors of texts use language for a specific purpose and a target audience. Grade-level expectations include: K-2.T.C.2.a authors & illustrators, speakers, narrators, and point of view; K-2.T.C.2.b *This progression begins in 6th grade.*; K-2.T.C.2.c *This progression begins in 3rd grade.*. description: DOMAIN: Texts (T) Students grow in their learning as they purposefully engage with texts.
details: CASE TOC context: English Language Arts Courses with Adopted Standards > Elementary English Language Arts K-5 > Language Arts/Grade 5
ALD: 5.T.C.1: Purpose & Audience – Use knowledge of purposes and audiences, as well as the language that develops those relationships, to make meaning of texts in multiple modes. Four achievement levels apply (Beginning, Developing, Proficient, Distinguished) with cumulative progression expectations. 5.T.C.2: Authors & Speakers – Make connections between authors of texts, speakers in texts, varying perspectives, and the circumstances in which texts are produced. Four achievement levels apply (Beginning, Developing, Proficient, Distinguished) with cumulative progression expectations. 5.T.SS.1: Organization – Demonstrate and apply understanding of organizational structures and elements to create coherent and engaging texts. Four achievement levels apply (Beginning, Developing, Proficient, Distinguished) with cumulative progression expectations.
evidence: 3-5.T.C.1 (Purpose & Audience) Use knowledge of purposes and audiences, as well as the language that develops those relationships, to make meaning of texts in multiple modes. Grade-level expectations include: 3-5.T.C.1.a determine the purpose & audience; explain development of purpose; identify multiple purposes; 3-5.T.C.1.b recognize and classify text modes; describe how author’s choice of mode influences audience and contributes to purpose and effect; 3-5.T.C.1.c create multimodal texts for a specific purpose and audience. 3-5.T.C.2 (Authors & Speakers) Make connections between authors of texts, speakers in texts, varying perspectives, and the circumstances in which texts are produced. Grade-level expectations include: 3-5.T.C.2.a describe and compare & contrast perspectives and their influence on text; 3-5.T.C.2.b *This progression starts in 6th grade.*; 3-5.T.C.1.c Identify and make inferences about context. 3-5.T.SS.1 (Organization) Demonstrate and apply understanding of organizational structures and elements to create coherent and engaging texts. Grade-level expectations include: 3-5.T.SS.1.a text features and organizational structures; 3-5.T.SS1.b design texts using a variety of text structures and features according to purpose and audience; 3-5.T.SS.1.c use conjunctions and transition words to add cohesion and link ideas.
